feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued February 12 at 9:14PM AKST until February 13 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Juneau. * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are also approaching freezing,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 7:04PM AKST until February 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast. * WHEN...Through noon Sunday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches, are expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 11:04AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill near 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwestern Brooks Range; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 11:01AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill 40 to 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. Cold temperatures continue in the Chukchi Sea and Norton Sound Regions with low temperatures in the 20s to 30s below, while high temperatures will be in the teens and 20s below.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 10:59AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...3 To 5 Inches Of Snow Tonight Through Sunday... Snow is expected to develop Saturday evening across the Central Interior and continue into Sunday evening. Between 3 and 5 inches of snow is expected by Sunday evening when the snow tapers off. In Fairbanks 3 to 4 inches of snow is expected, with 5 inches of snow from Two Rivers east.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 4:01AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...QUICK COAT OF LIGHT SNOW AND SLICK ROADS EARLY THIS MORNING... A band of snow will occur in the hours up to dawn this morning as colder air moves into the region, with a quick inch or so of accumulation, especially in the Poconos. With temperatures falling through the 20s to even some upper teens by 8 AM, untreated roads will become slick. Exercise caution if traveling this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Southern Wayne
